en.title: How to Trim Your Cat's Nails: Safe Techniques and Frequency
en.content:
Nail trimming is essential care for indoor cats. Overgrown nails can not only damage furniture but also cause injuries to the cat itself or get caught on curtains.

How Often to Trim

Every 2 to 3 weeks is a good guideline. The front claws grow faster than the back ones, so focus on checking the front paws.

How to Cut Safely

Use cat-specific nail clippers (guillotine type or scissor type). Avoid the pink part of the nail (the "quick," which contains blood vessels and nerves) and only cut the transparent tip. If you accidentally cause bleeding, apply styptic powder and apply pressure to stop the bleeding.

Tips for Reluctant Cats

Try trimming 1 or 2 nails at a time while your cat is sleeping or drowsy, reward with treats, or wrap your cat in a towel to help them stay calm. Rather than forcing all nails at once, it is also effective to spread the task over several days.

zh.title: 猫咪剪指甲的方法：安全的操作方式与频率
zh.content:
剪指甲是室内猫不可或缺的日常护理。过长的指甲不仅会划伤家具，还可能导致猫咪自身受伤或勾住窗帘。

剪指甲的频率

大约每2至3周一次为宜。前爪比后爪长得快，应重点检查前爪。

安全的剪法

使用猫咪专用指甲剪（断头台式或剪刀式）。避开指甲中粉红色的部分（含有血管和神经的“血线”），只剪透明的尖端部分。万一不慎出血，请涂抹止血粉并按压止血。

猫咪抗拒时的技巧

可以趁猫咪睡着或犯困时每次剪1至2个指甲、用零食奖励、或用毛巾包裹猫咪帮助其安静下来。不必强行一次剪完，分几天完成也是很有效的方法。
